intro: Copaifera gynohirsuta, commonly known as the hairy copaiba, is a species of flowering plant in the family Leguminosae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Peru. The plant is characterized by its woody stem, compound leaves, and small, clustered flowers. It produces a resinous sap that has been used traditionally for its medicinal properties. The botanical features of Copaifera gynohirsuta make it an important species in both ecological and pharmaceutical contexts.
